oai_dc:dc.dc:description: "Rag money" was paper currency made from linen and cotton fibers. A "shin-plaster" was printed small change. "Hard money" was coins made of a precious metal. This broadside was attempting to popularize these terms to be used as descriptions of political candidates.

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: At the end of James K. Polk's administration, Polk, then in declining health, announced that he would not seek reelection. The Whigs, who had been fiercely critical of Polk's war policies, reversed course and named Mexican war hero Zachary Taylor as their presidential candidate, to run against former Democratic Senator Lewis Cass of Michigan. The Whigs were sharply denounced by their opponents as hypocrites.
